Articles.Content:
As per title, this is not quite a replica (due to me not wanting to sit around tweaking it for hours), but a mock-up. It's quite similar to the proposed real one though. This is a project that's quite dear to my heart as a Marine pilot-in-training. I want nothing more than to fly one of these someday.

Here's the articles I modeled after, you can get an idea of what it does from these: http://www.popsci.com/military-aviation-space/gallery/2006-12/semper-fly-marines-space/?image=0 , http://www.dailykos.com/story/2009/03/03/703975/-Semper-Fly-Marines-in-Space-New-Poll

But let me know how I did! It flies okay, for some reason the CoL is not quite center even though everything was built in symmetry (that might just be a glitch) And YES, it is a SSTO! I tested it to 100km after losing about 800 m/s in flight (due to not paying attention and yawing 90 degrees), it's certainly capable of more. And it certainly does the job DARPA intended it for. Two pilots and capable of delivering 12 marines to anywhere on Kerbin (as well as the Mun I guess) in less than two hours. Even though it's supposed to be 13 marines. Whatever.

It could probably use a little more tweaking.

Mods used:

LLL (those counterweights are ,y favorite things ever)

B9 (I really need to find some better landing gear)

KW (struts)

P-Wings
